item.title: Hello World
item.description:
Welcome to your new blog.

This post is written in Markdown, and it includes:

  • Tags (for labeling)
  • Categories (for grouping)
  • Series (for grouping a set of related posts)

item.title: How Do Computers Work?
item.description:
Computers feel like magic‚Ä¶ but they‚Äôre actually super fast rule-followers.

A computer doesn‚Äôt ‚Äúthink‚Äù like a human.
It follows instructions very, very fast ‚Äî using electricity and tiny switches.

1) Computers speak ONE simple language: 1s and 0s

Inside a computer, everything becomes:

  • 1 = ON
  • 0 = OFF

That‚Äôs it.

Games, YouTube, homework, Roblox, Minecraft ‚Äî it all becomes huge patterns of 1s and 0s.

item.title: My Favorite Reliability Signals
item.description:
A simple way to think about reliability signals:

  • Latency: how fast?
  • Traffic: how much?
  • Errors: how broken?
  • Saturation: how full?

item.title: What Is Calculus? (Explained Like You‚Äôre 5)
item.description:
If you hear the word calculus, it probably sounds big. Complicated. Slightly terrifying.

Relax.

At its heart, calculus is just the math of change.

And if you‚Äôre five years old, you already understand change better than you think.

The World Is Always Changing

Think about your day:

  • A balloon gets bigger when you blow into it üéà
  • You ride your bike faster and faster üö≤
  • Rain fills up a bucket drop by drop üåßÔ∏è
  • You grow taller every year

Nothing stays still.

item.title: What Is Genetics?
item.description:
üß¨ What Is Genetics? (Explained Simply)

Have you ever looked at your family and thought‚Ä¶

‚ÄúWhy do I look like my dad?‚Äù
‚ÄúWhy does my sister have curly hair but I don‚Äôt?‚Äù
‚ÄúWhy are my eyes brown?‚Äù

The answer to all of those questions lives inside something tiny ‚Äî something so small you can‚Äôt see it.

It‚Äôs called DNA.

And the study of DNA and how traits are passed down from parents to children is called genetics.
